      • read

        public TileReader.ReadResult read​(long srcX,
                                  long srcY,
                                  long srcW,
                                  long srcH,
                                  int dstW,
                                  int dstH,
                                  byte[] buf)
        Description copied from class: TileReader
        Reads an arbitrary region of the image at an arbitrary scale. The source data will be scaled to meet dstW and dstH.
        Specified by:
        read in class TileReader
        Parameters:
        srcX - The source (unscaled) x-coordinate of the region
        srcY - The source (unscaled) y-coordinate of the region
        srcW - The source (unscaled) width of the region
        srcH - The source (unscaled) height of the region
        dstW - The output width
        dstH - The output size
        buf - Output buffer for the data of the specified tile
        Returns:
        true if the read completed successfuly, false if the operation was canceled asynchronously
        See Also:
        TileReader.read(int, long, long, byte[])

      • getTransferSize

        protected int getTransferSize​(int width,
                              int height)
        Description copied from class: TileReader
        Returns the transfer size, in bytes, for a buffer of width by height pixels.

        Defaults to this.getPixelSize()*width*height.

        Overrides:
        getTransferSize in class TileReader
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the output buffer
        height - The height of the output buffer
        Returns:
        The number of bytes required for an output buffer capable of holding width by height pixels.

      • disposeImpl

        protected void disposeImpl()
        Description copied from class: TileReader
        Implementation specific disposal. Implementations should always invoke super.disposeImpl().

        The default implementation marks TileReader.valid as false.

        This method will always be externally synchronized on this.readLock.

        Overrides:
        disposeImpl in class TileReader

      • cancel

        protected void cancel()
        Description copied from class: TileReader
        Implements asynchronous cancel. This method is invoked by the actively servicing TileReader.ReadRequest and should never be invoked externally.

        The default implementation returns immediately.

        Overrides:
        cancel in class TileReader
